Well, the usual suspects—Czechoslovakia, Yugoslavia, the USSR—have all broken up. Based on the way countries operate, I don’t think any will break up. However, there are some long shots: The USA, especially if the Trumpsters keep up their idiocies after Trump is out of office. India. India seems to have some of the same problems as the US with its political parties. Maybe the Democratic Republic of the Congo (formerly Zaire). The ethnic problems there keep continuing. Of course, a breakup of a country is rarely peaceful; Czechoslovakia and the USSR were exceptions. The more common way to break up is a la Yugoslavia, with a bunch of wars. Just my $0.02
